                                          T
                                          -
                                          1
                                       
                                    
                                    F
                                    (
                                    
                                       
                                          Y
                                       
                                       
                                          T
                                          -
                                          1
                                       
                                    
                                    )
                                    }
                                    .
                                 
                              
                           
                        

Alternatively, in order to speed up the convergence process, the upper bounds of the transformation factors of material s for manufacturer j can be kept in the feasible set as it is the case for relationship levels in Wakolbinger and Nagurney (2004). In this case an iteration for the transformation factors can be expressed as:
                              
                                 (17)
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          B
                                       
                                       
                                          T
                                       
                                    
                                    =
                                    
                                       min

                                          1
                                       
                                    
                                    F
                                    (
                                    
                                       
                                          B
                                       
                                       
                                          T
                                          -
                                          1

                                    }
                                    }

                           where 
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             b

                                 4
                              
                            in the numerical analysis.

In what follows, in order to apply the Euler method, we require the operator F to be strict monotone (Nagurney & Zhang, 1996) (see Figs. 1 and 2).
                              Theorem 4
                              
                                 The vector function F that enters the variational inequality 
                                 
                                    (14)
                                  
                                 is strictly monotone with respect to

                                                                     ″
                                                                  
                                                               
                                                            
                                                         
                                                      
                                                      +
                                                      
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               ∑
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               j
                                                               =
                                                               1
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               n
                                                            
                                                         
                                                      
                                                      
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               ∑
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               s
                                                               =
                                                               1
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               o
                                                            
                                                         
                                                      
                                                      
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               
                                                                  
                                                                     
                                                                        
                                                                           b
                                                                        
                                                                        
                                                                           ¯
                                                                        
                                                                     
                                                                  
                                                                  
                                                                     js
                                                                  
                                                                  
                                                                     u

                                                                     β
                                                                  
                                                                  
                                                                     js
                                                                  
                                                                  
                                                                     ′

                                                                                    ¯
                                                                                 
                                                                              
                                                                           
                                                                           
                                                                              js
                                                                           
                                                                           
                                                                              u

                                                                              β
                                                                           
                                                                           
                                                                              js

                                                                     ∊
                                                                  
                                                                  
                                                                     js
                                                                  
                                                                  
                                                                     ′
                                                                  
                                                               
                                                               -
                                                               
                                                                  
                                                                     ∊
                                                                  
                                                                  
                                                                     js
                                                                  
                                                                  
                                                                     ″
                                                                  
                                                               
                                                            
                                                         
                                                      
                                                   
                                                
                                             
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                 
                              

The terms that include Lagrangian multipliers are canceled out, except for the terms that include 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             ν
                                          
                                          
                                             js
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                 . Thus, simplifying (19), one can obtain
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             
                                                
                                                
                                                   
                                                      
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               ∑
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               i

                                                               1

                                                                                       r
                                                                                    
                                                                                 
                                                                                 
                                                                                    
                                                                                       q
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                       ij
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                       
                                                                                          
                                                                                             r
                                                                                          
                                                                                          
                                                                                             ″
                                                                                          
                                                                                       
                                                                                    
                                                                                 
                                                                                 -
                                                                                 
                                                                                    
                                                                                       x
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                       js
                                                                                    
                                                                                    
                                                                                       ″
                                                                                    
                                                                                 
                                                                              
                                                                           
                                                                        
                                                                        -
                                                                        
                                                                           
                                                                              
                                                                                 
                                                                                    z
                                                                                 
                                                                                 
                                                                                    ¯
                                                                                 
                                                                              
                                                                           
                                                                           
                                                                              j
                                                                           
                                                                        
                                                                     
                                                                  
                                                               
                                                            
                                                         
                                                      
                                                      ·
                                                      
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               
                                                                  
                                                                     ν
                                                                  
                                                                  
                                                                     js
                                                                  
                                                                  
                                                                     ′
                                                                  
                                                               
                                                               -
                                                               
                                                                  
                                                                     ν
                                                                  
                                                                  
                                                                     js
                                                                  
                                                                  
                                                                     ″
                                                                  
                                                               
                                                            
                                                         
                                                      
                                                   
                                                
                                             
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                 
                              

The strict convexity of 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             β
                                          
                                          
                                             js
                                          
                                          
                                             ′
                                          
                                       
                                       
                                          
                                             
                                                
                                                   
                                                      q
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      js
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      
                                                         
                                                            v
                                                         
                                                         
                                                            ′
                                                         
                                                      
                                                   
                                                
                                                +
                                                
                                                   
                                                      ∑
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      i
                                                      =
                                                      1
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      m
                                                   
                                                
                                                
                                                   
                                                      
                                                         
                                                            α
                                                         
                                                         
                                                            ¯
                                                         
                                                      
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      ijs
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      r
                                                   
                                                
                                                
                                                   
                                                      q
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      ij
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      
                                                         
                                                            r
                                                         
                                                         
                                                            ′
                                                         
                                                      
                                                   
                                                
                                                -
                                                
                                                   
                                                      x
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      js
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      ′
                                                   
                                                
                                             
                                          
                                       
                                       -
                                       
                                          
                                             
                                                
                                                   z
                                                
                                                
                                                   ¯
                                                
                                             
                                          
                                          
                                             j
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                  was proven in Section 2.1. Since 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             f
                                          
                                          
                                             js
                                          
                                       
                                       ,
                                       
                                          
                                             
                                                
                                                   c
                                                
                                                
                                                   ̃
                                                
                                             
                                          
                                          
                                             j
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                 , and 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             t
                                          
                                          
                                             j
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                  are strictly convex functions as shown in Table 5, the matrix of the second derivatives of those functions are positive definite. Thus, these functions are strictly monotone (Nagurney, 1999). From Table 5, 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             a
                                          
                                          
                                             i
                                          
                                       
                                       ,
                                       
                                       -
                                       
                                          
                                             ∊
                                          
                                          
                                             i
                                          
                                       
                                       ,
                                       
                                       
                                          
                                             r
                                          
                                          
                                             js
                                          
                                       
                                       ,
                                       
                                       
                                          
                                             c
                                          
                                          
                                             j
                                          
                                       
                                       ,
                                       
                                       -
                                       
                                          
                                             ρ
                                          
                                          
                                             js
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                  are also strictly increasing monotone functions. 
                                    
                                       -
                                       
                                          
                                             ν
                                          
                                          
                                             js
                                          
                                       
                                       
                                          
                                             β
                                          
                                          
                                             js
                                          
                                       
                                       
                                          
                                             
                                                
                                                   α
                                                
                                                
                                                   ¯
                                                
                                             
                                          
                                          
                                             ijs
                                          
                                          
                                             r
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                  and 
                                    
                                       -
                                       
                                          
                                             ν
                                          
                                          
                                             js
                                          
                                       
                                       
                                          
                                             β
                                          
                                          
                                             js
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                  are strictly monotone functions. Hence, 
                                    
                                       F
                                       (
                                       Y
                                       )
                                    
                                  is strict monotone if and only if 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             Y
                                          
                                          
                                             ′
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                  not equal 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             Y
                                          
                                          
                                             ″
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                 .□

Regulatory measures often focus on collection rates, e.g., in the recast of the WEEE directive mandatory collection targets of 65 percent are proposed. Our numerical example analyzes how these changes impact manufacturers’ decisions in forward and reverse supply chains. Fig. 3
                        (a) and (b) show the impacts of the minimum required collection amounts (
                           
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          τ
                                       
                                       
                                          ¯
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    j
                                 
                              
                           
                        ) on virgin materials bought and products collected as well as the transformation factor.


                        Fig. 3(a) indicates that, in the base case of the numerical example studied, it is in manufacturers’ financial interest to collect 2348 tons of WEEE. Recycled material is cheaper than virgin material up to the collection amount of 2348 tons. Hence, if the minimum required collection rate is below this limit, then it has no effect on manufacturers’ behavior. Total costs that manufacturers incur remain the same up to that level of the minimum required collection amount. As Fig. 3(b) shows, in this setting, the most efficient product design is chosen (i.e., 
                           
                              
                                 
                                    β
                                 
                                 
                                    ∗
                                 
                              
                              =
                              4.0
                           
                        ) due to high input prices. This implies that the effect of virgin material input prices is greater than the influence of 
                           
                              β
                           
                         on production costs.

If the minimum collection amount is raised above 2348 tons, then manufacturers are forced to collect more end-of-life products and their total costs increase. As anticipated by policy-makers, recycled materials substitute for virgin materials and the quantities of virgin materials bought decrease. Once the quantity of virgin materials purchased becomes zero, then manufactures start reducing the transformation factor, 
                           
                              β
                           
                        , as shown in Fig. 3(b). Manufacturers use a product design that requires more inputs and save production costs.

Based on this result, we next analyze which factors most effectively affect product dematerialization (i.e., 
                           
                              β
                           
                         increases). Three factors can be considered based on our model. The first factor that could affect product dematerialization is manufacturers’ recyclability rate (
                           
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          α
                                       
                                       
                                          ¯
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    ijs
                                 
                                 
                                    r
                                 
                              
                           
                        ). Manufacturers have introduced new technologies that allow for dematerialization of products. For example, a FRD screen uses a bit more than 50 percent of materials of CRT screens in terms of weight (Electronic Product Stewardship, 2009). However, economic inefficiency of recycling smaller materials in products has also been pointed out. Recycling FRD is more costly due to smaller amounts of recyclable materials included and complicated product designs (PC 3R Promotion Association, 2011). The second factor that could influence dematerialization is demand for new products (i.e., 
                           
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          z
                                       
                                       
                                          ¯
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    j
                                 
                              
                           
                        ). Manufacturers need to appropriately deal with increasing demands for products and rising costs of raw materials. Some manufacturers, such as Hitachi, try to cope with these conditions by pursuing dematerialization (The Nikkei American Edition, 2012); others, such as Sharp, increase the use of recycled or alternative materials (Souma, 2009). The third factor is the impact of providing manufacturers with the possibility of selling recycled materials. In the next three subsections, we observe impacts of these three options on the material transformation factor, 
                           
                              β
                           
                        , and on the trade-off between virgin and recycled material use.

Concerning the percentage of recyclable materials that can be extracted from products, two opposing trends can be observed. On the one hand, manufacturers, like Sony in Japan increase the amount of materials that can be extracted by providing product parts with labels that indicate their material compositions and by designing their products in such a way that they can be easily disassembled. On the other hand, manufacturers develop technologies to lighten products and use fewer raw materials. A pilot study about rare metal recycling from PCs conducted by the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry Japan argued that the smaller amounts of recyclable materials included in products lower the economic efficiency of recycling (The Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry Japan, 2012). Here, we examine the impact of changes in the percentage of recyclable material s that manufacturer j can extract 
                           
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          α
                                       
                                       
                                          ¯
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    ijs
                                 
                                 
                                    r
                                 
                              
                           
                         on new product design. Results are shown in Table 7
                        .

The final results of the analysis in Section 5.2 provide the starting values for this analysis. In this case 
                           
                              
                                 
                                    τ
                                 
                                 
                                    j
                                 
                              
                              =
                              4550
                              ,
                              
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          α
                                       
                                       
                                          ¯
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    ijs
                                 
                                 
                                    r
                                 
                              
                              =
                              0.4
                           
                         and 
                           
                              
                                 
                                    β
                                 
                                 
                                    j
                                    1
                                 
                              
                              =
                              3.0
                           
                        . The parameter 
                           
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          α
                                       
                                       
                                          ¯
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    ijs
                                 
                                 
                                    r
                                 
                              
                           
                         is then systematically reduced. For the parameter rage of 
                           
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          α
                                       
                                       
                                          ¯
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    ijs
                                 
                                 
                                    r
                                 
                              
                           
                         explored in the paper, the amount of recycled materials acquired always stays the same. Manufacturers acquire as much as required by the collection target in all cases. The reason is that the target rate is above the rate that manufacturers would acquire if they could freely chose their collection rate. This situation does not change even if 
                           
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          α
                                       
                                       
                                          ¯
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    ijs
                                 
                                 
                                    r
                                 
                              
                           
                         is reduced. Hence, manufacturers cannot improve their situation without violating regulations concerning minimum collection rates.

The parameter 
                           
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          α
                                       
                                       
                                          ¯
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    ijs
                                 
                                 
                                    r
                                 
                              
                           
                         has a relatively strong influence on the amount of virgin materials acquired and the transformation factor. A reduction of the original value of 
                           
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          α
                                       
                                       
                                          ¯
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    ijs
                                 
                                 
                                    r
                                 
                              
                           
                         first leads to an increase in the transformation factor and then it leads to an increase in the amount of virgin materials acquired. Hence, this shows that improving product design is less costly than acquiring virgin materials in this case. Manufacturers first use their resources more efficiently and then buy additional virgin materials to reach their production goals. Due to high transaction costs (i.e., collection, sorting and dismantling) associated with the end-of-life products, manufacturers do not increase recycled material usage to reach their production goals.

Impacts of changes in collection targets on product design also strongly depend on the demand for this product. Changes in demand can be caused by economic conditions. Furthermore, demand changes as products reach different stages in their product life-cycle, that is, introduction, growth, maturity and decline phases. Table 8
                         shows how changes in quantities of new products produced influence the demand for virgin and recycled materials and the transformation factor.

As in the previous case, the starting scenario of this analysis is the ending scenario of Section 5.2. As in Section 5.3, the amount of products that is recycled is stable and stays at the level required by the collection target. An increase of demand for new products first increases the transformation factor and then leads to more virgin material being acquired and used because improving product designs is more cost efficient than acquiring additional virgin materials in this case. Due to high transaction costs caused by necessary procurement and treatment of end-of-life products, manufacturers do not increase usage of recycled materials to meet demand.

Increases in demand for new products similarly influence material acquisition and product design decisions as reductions in the amount of recyclable materials included in products. Both lead to improved product design and increasing production and sourcing costs for manufactures. In case of increases in demand, however, these costs are partly or fully offset by increasing sales revenue.

We also analyze impacts if recycled material s cannot only be used as a raw material for producing new products but can also be sold in a recycled material market as it can be observed in the case of high purity plastics. We assume that 
                           
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          θ
                                       
                                       
                                          ¯
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    s
                                 
                              
                              =
                              2000
                           
                         and 
                           
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          κ
                                       
                                       
                                          ¯
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    s
                                 
                              
                              =
                              0.01
                           
                        . The numerical examples indicate that in this case for a minimum required collection amount of up to 3550, the results are exactly the same as in the case without the sales option. These results are shown in Figs. 3(a) and (b). However, when the minimum collection rate increases further and reaches values of 4050 and 4550, then manufactures still choose the most efficient product designs and sell some of the recycled material on the market for recycled materials. These results indicate the importance of establishing markets for recycled materials and for providing manufacturers with easy access to these markets.

In this paper, we provide an example of an economic network with nonlinear constraints. The model from the context of reverse logistics consists of three tiers. In that case, unlike a model with linear constraints, we need to carefully verify the convexity of the feasible set and satisfaction of a constraint qualification. We first present end-users’ and manufacturers’ behavior and the resulting equilibrium and optimality conditions. We provide conditions that ensure that the problem can be formulated as a variational inequality. Using Lagrange theory, we prove that the model can be solved. Finally, we provide numerical examples that highlight how the model developed in this paper can be used by policy-makers and manufacturers to anticipate effects of new legislation and changes in economic conditions. The numerical examples show the possible negative influence of required minimum collection amounts on product design decisions. Furthermore, the numerical examples indicate how changes in demand and percentages of recyclable material included can reduce this effect. The importance of the establishment of sound markets for recyclable materials and of providing manufacturers easy access to these markets is highlighted.

We anticipate that other economic networks that have previously been formulated using variational inequalities would also benefit from the introduction of nonlinear constraints. Examples could be forward supply chains, electricity networks, transportation networks as well as closed-loop supply chains with nonlinear constraints. The model and proofs in this paper provide a foundation for future research in this area.
